snippet: For the participants in a chorus of Russian-speaking immigrants, 60-minute singing sessions are a much-anticipated bright spot in lives that can be darkened by illness or loneliness.
abstract: Learning English Through Singing Group, which offers 60-minute singing sessions to Russian immigrants, is one of numerous programs supported by Edith and Carl Marks Jewish Community House of Bensonhurst, Brooklyn, supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases fund.
lead_paragraph: For the participants in a chorus of Russian-speaking immigrants, 60-minute singing sessions are a much-anticipated bright spot in lives that can be darkened by illness or loneliness.

headline.seo: Show Tunes, Sinatra and ‘God Bless America,’ With a Russian Accent
